result.execSummary:
The defendant Cornelius S Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: with credit for 15 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
EACH COUNT: Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
- Restitution is set at $0.

No contact with firearms.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".

Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention and continued programming.
- Parenting classes.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and recommended treatment/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

timeConds.notes: As to each Count 1 and 2:  Serve 30 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 8-12-2016 at 1:30pm in Branch 21.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR COURT OBLIGATIONS RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS

Defendant Cornelius S Miller in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Cornelius S Miller not in court.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  
Bail Forfeiture Hearing proceeded.  Surety, failing to appear, court orders cash bail/bond to remain forfeited.
Case is scheduled for BAIL/BOND FORFEITURE HEARING ON 09-02-2016 at 9:00 a.m. before Judge Maxine White. Notices mailed to defendant and surety.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00) gj

Defendant Cornelius S Miller in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.

As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 15 days time served.  The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

As to Count 2:  The court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to Count 1.  The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- As to each Count 1 and 2:  Serve 30 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 8-12-2016 at 1:30pm in Branch 21.
- Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention and continued programming.
- AODA and recommended treatment/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- Parenting classes.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
- Obtain GED or HSED.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
- Restitution is set at $0.
- 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant to have no contact with: ACS dob: 8/18/91

Defendant Cornelius S Miller in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Cornelius S Miller in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. pending sentencing. Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing on May 23, 2016 at 8:30am, Branch 47.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney J. Dennis Thornton in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
All cash bail on deposit to be forfeited.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Case recalled; same appearances.

As to Count 1 and Count 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 38.  Jury trial is vacated.

Defendant Cornelius S Miller in court with Attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State informs Court they are ready to proceed to trial on today's date.
Court has a number of trials (unrelated to this case) scheduled today and orders case passed.

  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Cornelius S Miller in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Cornelius S Miller in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
